intro: Hepetis schlimii, commonly known as the Schlim's bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, sky-blue to violet flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
